ai.summary: Crowan BR 134 is a very short, easy hike in the Crowan area of the United Kingdom. At around 0.5 km, it offers a light, family-friendly stroll along quiet paths and rural lanes, with minimal elevation and pleasant countryside views. This trail is ideal for beginners, kids, or anyone looking for a quick outdoor experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat or gently undulating terrain. Surfaces are mainly well-maintained footpaths and quiet country lanes; expect short sections of grass, occasional mud after rain, and gates or small stiles to cross. Views include hedgerows, farmland, and rural scenery.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight before you go. Wear sturdy shoes and bring appropriate clothing. Stay on signed paths, be mindful of mud after rain, and watch for gates and livestock. In winter or after rain, surfaces may be slippery. Let someone know your plan if hiking alone.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight boots
Weather-appropriate clothing and a lightweight waterproof layer
ai.best_seasons: All year, with the best conditions in late spring to early autumn when paths are dry and daylight is longer. Dress for the season and consider shorter daylight hours in winter.

seo.title: Crowan BR 134: Easy 0.5 km Hike in Crowan, UK
seo.meta_description: A quick and easy 0.5 km hike in Crowan, United Kingdom. This family-friendly stroll features flat terrain, simple paths, and countryside sceneryâ€”perfect for beginners and a short outdoor outing.
